description: This app works Great... love this email client!!

this is a great tool to check mails, i have 3 accounts being synchronized using this app. I love the interface and a lot other features that Mailspring provides. 
The search tool is efficient, a few themes are really good.
A few suggestions:
1. the app has been frequently crrashing, please continue to update more frequently.
2. can we have an option to set how many emails to download , eg 30 days, 15 days, etc or the limit to the total cache size.

This a very good looking application that i have ever discover
but currently i'm facing issue with with connecting gmail account i see on the screen that this app is blocked this should be resolved but this app is awesome.
summary: This a very good looking application that i have ever discover

description: Showed nothing in my inbox where I definately have mail.
This is the best mail client that Linux has in terms on how it looks and how easy it is to configure. Awesome work @mailspring!
I used Nylas before, now I use Mailspring. Looks nice.

One problem with default linux mail clients nowadays (in fact all Linux apps) is that the UIs look and feel dated and user experience is never at the top of the list during development. Evolutionary is powerful with tons of option but in the sense of visual appeal and easy of use, it is definitely not the best. This one is! Great theme and very easy to config. This should be the trend of linux app design in the coming years! Keep it going!
... and way better than all the other open source email clients I have used

My favorite email client is/was Apple Mail. Mailspring has a clean interface, similar to Apple Mail; and it just works. I would like to retire my Hackintosh as I do not like having to fix my OS for an upgrade and half the time I forget what I did to make it work in the first place. I have used Linux for 20+ years but I could never find an email client that I liked. Geary does not sync nicely with Apple email accounts. I have used Mailspring on my Windows disk and it has been working flawlessly. It looks like I may be able to switch over to Windows 10 (debloated) and Fedora. Maybe one day I will have a Fedora workstation only.
summary: Best email client for Linux IMHO

description: +1 for have to have a milspring ID
This is the best mail client that I've used, I've tried a few and could never stick to one. This is the first one I've used as much as I do. I really appreciate it being made fully open source too.
After struggling with the other Linux email clients I finally found Mailspring. It's the best cross platform email client I've used.
summary: The best Linux email client by far

description: Hands down the best Email client I have used on Linux so far. The UI is slick, everything is easy to find, and once you set it up the way you want, you can really focus on your communication and not worry about anything else. The subscription is also worth it if you are a working professional, helps out tremendously.
summary: Best Email Client for Linux I have used

description: You can login to others users

Extremely fast to load using Linux Ubuntu Mate and actually fun to use. It recognized all my Contacts without any intervention. I just wish the Signature lines could be formatted with different fonts and colors, but that is a minor complaint.
Stable, simple, elegant
This is a nice, full-featured mail client, but it's currently in need of an update to add Wayland support. On X11, it's fine but everything is blurry on Wayland when screen scaling is in use.

The app is great, but it currently uses too much CPU. They had a GitHub issue about this, which they migrated to their own website, so they're aware. I would be using this app if it wasn't because of this.
Really enjoy the design of this app
Rare that you find Linux apps with such a good UI
Crashed my computeur at first launch
Love that I can easily set up and retrieve emails across Gmail, Yahoo and Spectrum servers
summary: Great aggregate for all my email accounts

description: Gave permissions to mailspring in my Gmail account, but "oops" something went wrong, "please try again". and the same again, and again, and again. What use is shiny open source app that restricts its use for subscribers of their own ID system?
summary: Could not even connect to my Gmail account

description:
I'm new to linux (using Ubuntu) and this is now one of the nicest looking apps on my PC. And it works well with iCloud mail as well.

It's also great that the Mailspring ID is optional, so it can be used as a pure mail client without any extras as well.

Be aware that it seems to be an Electron app through, so is pretty heavy compared to other apps... But then again, mail apps need a good web rendering engine anyway.
summary: Great app, looks good and works well

description: Excellent mail client with basic support for enterprise accounts and superb interface.
summary: Excellent mail client with O365 support

description: My favorite app for mail, but I do not like that it change your mouse in mailspring. I don't know if it is mailspring or something else, but it would be cool if it could be fixed.
It's a neat app, but not supporting 2FA for Exchange accounts is a huge issue.
Usually, when contacting my client and business partner, I always use email. This email app is having a nice feature to see our sent email if has been read by the receiver.

So far I've using mailspring for a year and it works like a charm. However when using an office 365 account it continuosly losses access to it and ask me to reconnect and validate my credentials 3 or 4 times a day.
summary: Really nice email client - not for office 365

description: I like this app in ever other way, but I dislike conversation view so much I've stopped using this app because I can't find a way to turn conversation view off.
summary: I want to be able to turn off Conversation View

description: app gives error upon selecting office365 account.
Login attempt returns a 400, impossible to link my office365 account to Mailspring
I was looking an easy app to use with Apple mail account and this email app is simple and clean. works fine as it must.
it good has some weird connection problems though
No manual config options
navigating arouond is very easy. looks stunning.
85/100 enjoyed this app
I see that you have zero QA. I can't even open the application on fresh install.
summary: Blank screen on a fresh 22.04 install

description: Install doesn't complete since their web presence appears to be using expired security certificates.
The best replacement for thunderbird on linux so far. Very convenient. It works in the background correctly and the tray icon appears without any adjustments, unlike in most other linux mail clients
Well, it's not really good but on linux I guess Mailspring is good enough
stable application and very easy to use, excellent for work
App launches to a black screen Ubuntu 22.04 fresh install

It just works on Ubuntu 22.04.

I use it for multiple mailboxes for a couple of popular free email providers and a fee-based email provider.
summary: Modern UI and easy to set up

description: Installed went to open comes up to a blank screen, so a bit hard to write an hones treview
Great app, work well and it's easy to use

I need to keep my accounts separate, I have several for a reason. It's super annoying and confusing to select account again under Inbox, that some folders are under unified, some aren't. It defeats the purpose of arranging your stuff under one account.
It's just a no go unfortunately. I didn't even get to see how can I see the outlook.com calendar under my custom domain but probably can't seeing how this is all just imap.
summary: Forcing unified inbox is a terrible idea

description: I like it it is very easy and simple to use.
...and cannot sync with Outlook for Business

Only Snap available, and very slow to load. The deb package works much faster, but has to be installed and updated manually. 
Compatibility issues with Office365 for Business, only works with IMAP?, not exchange, or EWS so basically not compatible.

App looks really good. Has nice features such as send later or remind me later. Merges all inbox messages, from different accounts into one folder (still there is an option to check it indicidually, really great). Implements feature such as filter messages.
Hope that updates will add some new features, such as creating rules for messages filter after the right click, as in Outlook.
to be able to a) combine accounts, and b) have conversation threads. It's the only client that is able to do that!
summary: exactly what I was looking for

description:
Cannot connect SMPT/IMAP 
In the logs it can even be seen that the server responded correclty. Yet the tool thinks it cannot connect. This is a joke. Thunderbird, Evolution, Mailspring all having their unique flaws that make them practically useless. So frustrating.

my brther found an image tracker in each email sent, so that means they take all available information. what if you were sending somehting extremely private to somebody and some creepo stares at all your mesages.
It asked for permissions not related with email functionality.
summary: Requested email unrelated permissions on gmail

description: I love the graphical environment of this application, easy to use and very practical... there are some things that could work better with google mail
Works good. And is free.
Couldn't get it to work with a VPN active. Pretty much a dealbreaker for me.
Sure, not open source, but very aesthetically pleasing and also works well with Proton Mail app

the app seemed to load nice and fast it didnt detect the theme on my desktop but it took me seconds to find the theme changer and put it to the dark mode it looks way more modern then most email clients on linux thank you to the developer

I managed to connect to my iCloud mail account and ProtonMail (Using Proton Bridge) on Ubuntu 23.04 beta within minutes. 
Mailspring has a very clean interface and being able to choose between several layouts and themes is a bonus.

After moving from windows to linux, I was try possible all email applications. Only Mailspring fit to my needs perfectly. It is beautiful, not unnecessary complicated, powerful signature option, activity view in real time, high level of personalization...
Still did not try mail rules and templates. Good to have it in reserve. Overall rating 10/10.

What can be added: Automatic change dark/light theme by system default.
that shou;d be preinstalled ,on 22-04 ,instaed of evolution. same as for mozilla and chromium.regards

its the first app in which i just put the settings the company gave me and it works. Nothing else worked so smooth in the following list [apple mail ipad, iphone, mac, outlook mac, outlook windows, windows mail, thunderbird ubuntu, thunderbird windows].

keep up the great work guys. And NEVER change or simplify that Imap incoming and outgoing double window. Thats great.
summary: you saved my lenovo from being smashed against the wall

description: Well documented and very easy to customise just how you want to use it.
summary: A polished mail client with a smooth and easy to use interface

description: Easy to configure and use.
Help us in work
man- I want to get away from windows but these SMTP and pop issues since 2010 are killing me. fukc guys everyone is complaining about this.
I may be ignorant, but, I have to launch this snap 3x times at least before it will open. It's not a matter of waiting for it to load.

I really like the app, but it sends my emails twice!

Please fix this!
summary: Good app, but very annoying bug: Sends emails twice!

description:
It worked until the first update, and after that it's been unable toaccess my password despite me re-entering it numerous times.
I will be leaving this for another email client, because this one is clearly unfit for purpoose.
summary: Terrible. Worked for a little while, now is effectively useless

description: ... there are some critical bugs, like emails missing from the inbox or disappearing to trash. So it cannot be used as a business email client, but for personal purposes where losing one or two random emails per week is not critical - it's very good.
summary: Would be best mail client on Linux, unfortunately..

description: It was great when it worked. then it stopped syncing. now it won't remember authentication. Did all the recommended steps and will not work. pity I really loved it.

No explanationon what it needs when an error occurs 
other than the same semi-useless help page. No where 
does it explain what a Custome Container Folder is
or where it is located. If you're going to need some thing
then explain what/where you want it. Agree, it is a shame
really liked it.

Stopped working at the mentioned date. The APP had some limitations, but was a trusted one. It is not synchronizing anymore with the exchange servers. I will need to start using another APP. Unfortunately, I will uninstall Mailspring.
summary: It was OK- Worked fine until the 18 Nov 2023

description: You can still sign in, you just have to use an auto generated password. I had this problem and then figured it out after reading the instructions on the error pop up. If you're using Yahoo, you go to the yahoo website and get the auto generated password there.
summary: Still works Great! Just need to follow the instructions

description:
OK for personal use and set up quickly. But no updates since 2021!

Major problem is unable to create or edit Contacts

occasionally, after I hit send, I find out later that the mail never got sent, and I find it still sitting in my drafts folder. I started checking the outbox everytime after I send an email. It happens about every 10th email.
Endlich ein E-Mail Programm mit einem Outlook Feeling. Einfache Einrichtung, alle Funktionen die man braucht und vor allem macht es einen ordentlichen Eindruck
summary: Das Beste E-Mail Programm unter Linux

description: Lässt sich nicht installieren.

No solo se trata de las opciones visuales y de personalización disponibles. Opciones como la de traducir y ver cuando han visto tu correo, hacen de esta aplicación el mejor cliente de correo electrónico que he usado. +10
summary: El mejor cliente de correo que he tenido

description: Es bonita y rapida

Intenta parecerse a Outlook y no lo veo mal, el problema es que le faltan un par de cosas...
La bandeja de entrada no es posible verla como un directorio y tampoco tiene sección de favoritos en la barra izquierda.
La barra de la derecha me pareció un poco de más.

Aun así en apariencia es mejor que Thunderbird, no entiendo por qué se empeña en preservar la apariencia más antigua, le daré seguimiento a ambos :D
es rapido, confiable, minimalista, util, adaptable y demas, cumple con todo lo nesesario
estuve usando thunderbird desde que instalè Linux, y el programa tildaba la laptop al punto de quedar completamente congelada, con Mailspring se acabò este problema
summary: Aplicaciòn sencilla de usar y muy ligera

description: Error con cuentas office365

La versión de Flatpak raramente no me había funcionado pero la versión de Snap sí me funcionó, si no les funciona a ustedes la version de Snap traten de desinstalarlo, escribir "sudo apt install gnome-keyring" en la terminal, y volver a instalar Mailspring y les debería funcionar.

Estoy en KDE neon.
summary: La versión de Flatpak no me funcionó

Desde la ultima actualización ya no puede loguearse. Da un error de Token autenticación:

summary: El mailsping se desconecta y reconecta con office 365, es inestable

description: Lo unico malo es que la opcion grautita tiene un limite de buzones, fuera de eso me parece la mejor opcion.
Interfaz cómodo. Funciona bien. Estoy muy conforme. Muchas gracias
el dia de hoy no he podido abrir en todo el dia, se queda pensando sin ternimar de abrir y no hace mas nada, la desinstale y volvi a instalar y sigue igual
Andaba muy bien
summary: Todo bien hasta hoy que dejo de funcionar

description: Suele funcionar de forma aceptable, pero el día de hoy dejo de funcionar
summary: Suele funcionar bien pero hoy dejo de funcionar

description: Con la nueva actualización dejó de funcionar. Desinstalé, volví a instalar y nada, incluso instalé el paquete .deb, pero tampoco abre la aplicación.
muy buena y muy facil de usar y facil de iniciar sesion
al tratar de enviar se congela la aplicacion

es un excelente lector de correo, permite integrar varias cuentas en una sola bandeja, y está muy bien pensado para que sea fácil de usar y configurar, tiene limitaciones para las que hay que pagar pero eso es así, yo lo uso para mis dos cuentas selectas y súper feliz

Probablemente el cliente de email mas bonito para linux, puedes manejar todos tus emails en una aplicacíon; sin embargo, a mi me da problemas de sincronización muy seguido por lo que es una buena aplicacion con un problema critico. 
Espero que en el futuro lo arreglen.
Excellente application pour une utilisation quotidienne multi-comptes
Pour une fois un client mail est joli et fluide tout en ayant toutes les fonctionnalités qu'on attend de lui!

Vraiment j'ai beaucoup aimé l'interface mais le compte Office 365 ne s'ouvre pas !

Merci de vérifier.
Ne démarre pas ???
Fait complètement planter l'ordinateur. Impossible à utiliser.

La connexion OAuth2 au compte Microsoft (adresses mail Live) ne fonctionne pas
La connexion IMAP sur une adresse OVH ne trouve pas le dossier Inbox

GMail ok, Hotmail ok, Orange ok
Рекоменду к использованию
KDE Neon. При нажатии на ярлык запуска просто ничего не происходит.
Удобный, красивый, хорошо синхронизируется с почтовыми сервисами
Обычный клиент, но не удобно что учётные записи по отдельности, а не списком. Чобы посмтореть почту учётки нужно прям её выбрать и тогда смотреть.
Довольно неплохой почтовый клиент с приятным интерфейсом. Добавить почту без регичтрации в сервисе можно это если у кого-то возникли с этим проблемы.

вообще приложение хорошее, на другом рабочем ноуте пользовался и проблем вроде не было. Но на этом - зависает рандомно, то просто когда список писем листаешь, то когда пишешь письмо, то еще что, и при зависании виснет вообще все, приходится перезагружать ноут вообще. Такого быть не должно.
Лучшее из того, что я видел для ubuntu
All chinese characthers will be displayed as 口口口口口
